title: Top 15 Beautiful Places to Visit in Asia in 2026 to Add to Your List
text:
Liputan6.com, Jakarta - A new year is here, and many people are already planning their trips for 2026. If you love to travel, this is the perfect time to think about where you want to go. Asia is still one of the best places to explore this year. The region offers a wide mix of culture, food, nature, and modern cities. From quiet islands to busy streets, Asia gives you many options for different travel styles and budgets. It is also easy to find places that are friendly for first-time travelers.
If you are planning a trip to this diverse continent, here are some of the most beautiful places to visit in Asia in 2026 to put on your list.
1. Hoi An, Vietnam
This old town in central Vietnam is famous for its yellow buildings and colorful lanterns that hang everywhere. The streets are small and perfect for walking, with many shops selling handmade items. You can see the Japanese Covered Bridge, explore the old merchant houses, and try delicious local food like cao lau and banh mi. At night, the lanterns light up the whole town and make it look magical. The beaches near Hoi An are also very nice and quiet, perfect for relaxing after exploring the town.

2. Busan, South Korea
Busan is the second largest city in South Korea and sits by the sea with a mountain backdrop. The city has beautiful beaches like Haeundae Beach and Gwangalli Beach where you can swim and relax. You can see the colorful houses at Gamcheon Culture Village and try fresh seafood at Jagalchi Fish Market, the largest in Korea. Haedong Yonggungsa Temple is a beautiful temple by the ocean with great views. The city is modern but also has traditional Korean culture, making it interesting for all types of travelers.
3. Labuan Bajo, Indonesia
This small fishing town is the gateway to Komodo National Park, home of the famous Komodo dragons. These are the largest lizards in the world and can only be found in this area. You can take boat trips to see pink sand beaches, swim with manta rays, and go diving in clear blue water with colorful coral reefs. The islands around Labuan Bajo are perfect for nature lovers who want to explore untouched areas. The sunsets here are some of the most beautiful you will ever see, especially from the hilltops.

4. Sigiriya, Sri Lanka
Sigiriya Rock is an ancient rock fortress that rises 200 meters above the green jungle below. The rock has old frescoes of beautiful women painted on the walls and water gardens at the bottom that are over 1,500 years old. You need to climb about 1,200 steps to reach the top, but the view of the surrounding countryside is worth every step. The area also has elephant safaris in nearby Minneriya National Park and other ancient sites like Dambulla Cave Temple. This place shows the rich history and wild nature of Sri Lanka together.
5. Osaka, Japan
Osaka is known for its amazing food scene and friendly, welcoming people who love to chat with visitors. You can try local favorites like takoyaki and okonomiyaki at Dotonbori, the most famous food street in the city with bright neon signs. Osaka Castle is a beautiful historical site with a large park around it where people have picnics. The city also has Universal Studios Japan for theme park fans and many modern shopping areas in Shinsaibashi. The nightlife here is lively and fun, with many bars and restaurants open late.

6. Xi'An, China
This ancient city was the starting point of the historic Silk Road and served as the capital for many Chinese dynasties. The Terracotta Army is the most famous sight here – thousands of life-sized clay soldiers that are over 2,000 years old, each with a different face. The old city wall is one of the best preserved in China and perfect for cycling around the entire city. The Muslim Quarter has amazing street food and a lively night market atmosphere. Xi'An shows you what old China looked like while being a modern, developed city today.
7. Singapore
Singapore is a modern city-state with clean streets, strict laws, and many green spaces throughout the urban areas. Gardens by the Bay has giant tree-like structures and beautiful flower domes filled with plants from around the world. You can shop on famous Orchard Road, eat cheap local food at hawker centers, and see the Marina Bay Sands building with its rooftop pool. Chinatown and Little India offer cultural experiences and traditional shopping. The city is very safe, easy to travel around using public transport, and perfect for first-time travelers to Asia.

8. Dubai, United Arab Emirates
Dubai has the tallest building in the world, the Burj Khalifa, which stands at 828 meters high with an observation deck. The city is famous for luxury shopping in massive malls, modern skyscrapers, and exciting desert adventures like dune bashing and camel riding. You can go to the traditional souks for gold and spices, enjoy the clean public beaches, or even ski inside the Mall of the Emirates. Dubai Marina and the man-made Palm Jumeirah island are also must-see places. The city perfectly mixes modern luxury life with traditional Arabian culture and hospitality.
9. Jaipur, India
The Pink City of India is full of magnificent palaces and impressive forts that show the royal history of Rajasthan. The Amber Fort sits on a hill and has beautiful architecture with mirror work and detailed carvings inside. You can see the City Palace where the royal family still lives and the Hawa Mahal with its 953 small windows. The local markets sell colorful textiles, silver jewelry, and traditional handicrafts at good prices. Jaipur gives you a true taste of royal Indian history, culture, and hospitality that the region is famous for.

10. Pokhara, Nepal
Pokhara is a peaceful lakeside city with amazing mountain views that attract nature lovers and adventure seekers. You can see the snow-covered Himalayas, including the Annapurna range and Machapuchare mountain, from many places in the city. Phewa Lake is perfect for peaceful boat rides with mountain reflections in the water, and the World Peace Pagoda sits on a hill above the lake. Many trekkers start their Himalayan adventures from Pokhara, heading to famous trails. The city is relaxed and has many cozy cafes, restaurants serving international food, and yoga centers.
11. Maldives
The Maldives is made up of over 1,000 coral islands with white sand beaches and crystal-clear turquoise water. The coral reefs here are some of the best in the world for diving and snorkeling, with many colorful fish and sea turtles. Many islands have luxury overwater resorts with private pools, but there are also local islands you can visit for a more affordable experience. The water is so clear and shallow that you can see tropical fish while standing on the beach. This is the perfect place for a romantic, relaxing holiday away from busy city life.

12. Koh Phi Phi, Thailand
These tropical islands became world-famous after the movie "The Beach" was filmed at Maya Bay in 1999. Maya Bay is the most popular spot with its dramatic limestone cliffs and incredibly clear water, though it's now protected to help nature recover. You can go snorkeling to see coral reefs, diving at various spots, or just relax on the beautiful beaches. The main island is small enough to walk around easily, and there are no cars or motorbikes here, making it peaceful. The sunsets are spectacular, and the beach nightlife is lively with fire shows and music.
13. Palawan, Philippines
Palawan is often called the most beautiful island in the world by travel magazines and tourists. El Nido has amazing limestone cliffs rising from the sea and hidden lagoons you can explore by kayak. Coron is famous for wreck diving where you can see Japanese ships from World War II and beautiful freshwater lakes. The water is crystal clear with many colors of blue and green, and the white sand beaches are quiet and not crowded. You can go island hopping tours and discover new beaches and snorkeling spots every day in this tropical paradise.

14. Jammu and Kashmir, India
This region in northern India is known as "Paradise on Earth" because of its natural beauty. Dal Lake in Srinagar has traditional wooden houseboats called shikaras where you can stay and enjoy the peaceful water. The mountains are covered with snow in winter and the valleys turn green with flowers in spring and summer. Gulmarg is one of the highest ski resorts in the world and perfect for winter sports. The area has beautiful Mughal gardens, old temples, and mosques to explore. The local Kashmiri culture is unique and the people are known for their warm hospitality.
15. Penang, Malaysia
Penang is a Malaysian island known for having some of the best street food in Asia and rich cultural history. George Town, the capital, has colorful street art on old buildings and well-preserved colonial architecture from the British era. The food here mixes Malay, Chinese, and Indian flavors in unique ways – you must try local dishes like char kway teow and laksa at the hawker centers. Penang Hill offers great views of the entire island and the mainland. The beaches on the north side like Batu Ferringhi are quiet and perfect for swimming and water sports.
